hook.text: A government can force you to obey. But when does it have the right to?

buildup.text: Legitimacy is what separates government from a protection racket. Both demand money and obedience.

discovery.text: Max Weber identified three sources of legitimacy: tradition, charisma, and rational-legal authority.

twist.text: Most modern states claim legal legitimacy. But laws written by the powerful often serve the powerful.

climax.text: When people stop believing a government is legitimate, revolutions follow â€” from France to the Arab Spring.

punchline.text: Power without legitimacy is just organized violence.

quiz.question: What is political legitimacy?
options: The right of a government to exercise authority
The size of a country's military
